Others: Atlanta Braves ace Chris Sale is out for the Wild Card Series against the San Diego Padres due to back issues.
Chris Sale was a last-minute scratch from the final game of the regular season against the New York Mets.
Manager Brian Snitker said the Braves will be without their top starting pitcher for the series against the Padres.
Journeyman Grant Holmes stepped in for Sale against the Mets, throwing one-hit ball over four innings as the Braves won 3-0 to clinch a wild-card berth.
The Braves will reassess Sale's status if they advance to the Division Series.
Snitker said Sale has dealt with back issues periodically all season, though the issue became more problematic after his most recent start.
Sale was scheduled to start last Wednesday against the Mets, but the game was rained out.
General manager Alex Anthopoulos insisted the latest round of back spasms only cropped up after a throwing session on Sunday.
Anthopoulos said it was decided before the start of the doubleheader that Sale would not be able to go.
Snitker made the injury sound more serious after the doubleheader, conceding that Sale will not be available until the second round at the earliest.
